title: Citi Philippines Retains Best Foreign Bank Award
summary: Manila - Citi was awarded Best Foreign Bank in the Philippines for the fifth consecutive year at the Alpha Southeast Asia Best Financial Institution Awards. Citi has consistently won this award since it was introduced in 2009.
tag-1: Citi Philippines Retains Best Foreign Bank Award
tag-3: Manila – Citi was awarded Best Foreign Bank in the Philippines for the fifth consecutive year at the Alpha Southeast Asia Best Financial Institution Awards. Citi has consistently won this award since it was introduced in 2009.
tag-4: This year, Alpha Southeast Asia cited Citi's 111-year history in the country and its leadership position as the financial partner of choice for corporate and consumer clients.
tag-5: In its editorial, the magazine said: "Citi has built the strongest combined capabilities among foreign banks in the country. Citi has consistently been one of the top three players in foreign exchange in terms of volume traded in the interbank market. The strength of its franchise and skill in execution has made Citi the bank of choice for the largest capital inflows into the country."
tag-6: Citi Country Officer Batara Sianturi thanked the organizers for the recognition and underscored the bank's commitment to its clients. "We continue to leverage our global platform in providing best-in-class products and services that serve the financial needs of our clients. Citi has enjoyed a legacy of success in the Philippines for more than a century, and we draw inspiration from this recognition as we take Citi into its next century," Sianturi said.
tag-7: Citi is the only foreign bank that has entered and consistently ranks among the top 10 commercial banks in the country. It boasts of a strong investment banking platform and provides the most comprehensive and advanced range of cash management, trade services, and global securities and funds services in the Philippines today. It remains a leader in Corporate Sales and Structuring, Trading, Fixed Income Sales and Research. It serves as the house bank by a majority of the largest and most important local and international companies and financial institutions in the country.
tag-8: Meanwhile, its consumer banking presence spans leadership in credit cards and wealth management, and a growing franchise for consumer finance.
tag-9: As the largest foreign commercial bank in the country, "Citi takes pride in being firmly entrenched in the Philippines. We remain committed to enabling progress in the country by continuously driving innovation and helping our clients achieve their dreams," concluded Sianturi.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
